funds.\r\r"},"return":"A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.\r\r"},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender.\r\r \r Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old\r\r and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this\r\r race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards:\r\r https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729\r\r","params":{"_spender":"The address which will spend the funds.\r\r","_value":"The amount of tokens to be spent.\r\r"}},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"Gets the balance of the specified address.\r\r","params":{"_owner":"The address to query the the balance of.\r\r"},"return":"An uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.\r\r"},"burn(uint256)":{"details":"Burns a specific amount of tokens.\r\r","params":{"_value":"The amount of token to be burned.\r\r"}},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"transfer token for a specified address\r\r","params":{"_to":"The address to transfer to.\r\r","_value":"The amount to be transferred.\r\r"}},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Transfer tokens from one address to another\r\r","params":{"_from":"address The address which you want to send tokens from\r\r","_to":"address The address which you want to transfer to\r\r","_value":"uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred\r\r"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.\r\r","params":{"newOwner":"The address to transfer ownership to.\r\r"}}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{"increaseApproval(address,uint256)":{"notice":"approve should be called when allowed[_spender] == 0. To increment\r\r allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until\r\r the first transaction is mined)\r\r From MonolithDAO Token.sol\r\r"}}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"project:/contracts/fuzz_contract.sol":"PCNCoin"},"evmVersion":"byzantium","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"project:/contracts/fuzz_contract.sol":{"keccak256":"0xfbd524407562356d1e3f0bbf513df29e11c47c452e7b3d2f530d30d56818a0e1","urls":["bzzr://93f1e43ea814e71450f04411ae7edde235e932d7dd420d17717a6e0962a7e229"]}},"version":1}

nodes.documentation:
@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
nodes.name: Ownable

nodes.documentation: @dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
nodes.name: transferOwnership

nodes.documentation:
approve should be called when allowed[_spender] == 0. To increment
allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until
the first transaction is mined)
From MonolithDAO Token.sol
nodes.name: increaseApproval

nodes.documentation:
@title Burnable Token
@dev Token that can be irreversibly burned (destroyed).
nodes.name: BurnableToken

nodes.documentation:
@dev Burns a specific amount of tokens.
@param _value The amount of token to be burned.
nodes.name: burn

nodes.documentation:
@title Crowdsale
@dev Crowdsale is a base contract for managing a token crowdsale.
Crowdsales have a start and end timestamps, where investors can make
token purchases and the crowdsale will assign them tokens based
on a token per ETH rate. Funds collected are forwarded 
to a wallet
as they arrive.
nodes.name: token
TokenPurchase

@title Crowdsale
@dev Crowdsale is a base contract for managing a token crowdsale.
Crowdsales have a start and end timestamps, where investors can make

allowance(address,address).details: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

params._owner: address The address which owns the funds.
params._spender: address The address which will spend the funds.

allowance(address,address).return: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

approve(address,uint256).details: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender.  Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

params._spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params._value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params._owner: The address to query the the balance of.

balanceOf(address).return: An uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.

burn(uint256).details: Burns a specific amount of tokens.

params._value: The amount of token to be burned.

transfer(address,uint256).details: transfer token for a specified address

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfer tokens from one address to another

params._from: address The address which you want to send tokens from
params._to: address The address which you want to transfer to
params._value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

increaseApproval(address,uint256).notice: approve should be called when allowed[_spender] == 0. To increment allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol
